sense.def:
To serve one's country, an organization, or a person
pomeni opravljati koristno delo za svojo državo, neko ustanovo ali osebo.

seg.quote: For over thirty years, she has served the company loyally and well.
He served with the army in France.

gramGrp.pos:
VB
with
ADJUNCT, TO-INF,
or
OBJ

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
serves as a particular thing
ali
serves a particular purpose
, ima uporaba tistega določen namen oziroma nečemu služi.

seg.quote: There was a long, grey building that served as a cafeteria.
His refusal to answer only serves to increase our suspicions.
I failed to see what purpose this could serve.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
serves people or an area
, ljudem ali nekemu območju da tisto, kar potrebuje.

seg.quote: There were five water taps to serve all thirty camps.

sense.def:
To serve people
ali
to serve food and drink
pomeni dati ljudem hrano in pijačo.

seg.quote: When everybody had been served, the meal began.
I served the children their meal.

sense.def:
Kadar prodajalec
serves someone
, stranki ponudi izdelke.

seg.quote: She spent six months serving in a shop.

sense.def:
Kadar sodišče
serves a legal order on someone
ali
serves someone with a legal order
, nekomu pošlje uradno odredbo;

To serve a prison sentence
pomeni preživeti določen čas v zaporu.

seg.quote: He is now serving a life sentence in an Italian jail.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo pri tenisu
serves
, vrže žogico v zrak, jo udari z loparjem in tako začne igro.

seg.quote: Her second serve went into the net.

sense.def:
It serves someone right
rečemo takrat, ko se nekomu zgodi nekaj neprijetnega, za kar je po našem mnenju kriv sam, zato se nam prav nič ne smili.

To serve out food
ali
to serve it up
pomeni ljudem dati obrok hrane.

seg.quote: Army kitchens serve up better fare than some hotels do.
